question.title: Correct use of arrayBaseOffset and arrayIndexScale

node.contents: Have you tried referencing the fully qualified object name. i.e `sun.misc.Unsafe`?

astNode.text: Have you tried referencing the fully qualified object name. i.e `sun.misc.Unsafe`?

node.contents: I have defined a simple array and I want to use Unsafe.arrayBaseOffset and Unsafe.arrayIndexScale with the following snippet.

astNode.text: I have defined a simple array and I want to use Unsafe.arrayBaseOffset and Unsafe.arrayIndexScale with the following snippet.

elements.contents: import sun.misc.Unsafe; public class Arr { public static void main(String[] args) { int [] a = new int[3]; a[0] = 10; a[1] = 20; a[2] = 30; int baseOffset = Unsafe.arrayBaseOffset(a.getClass()); int indexScale = Unsafe.arrayIndexScale(a.getClass()); } }

units.rawText: import sun.misc.Unsafe; public class Arr { public static void main(String[] args) { int [] a = new int[3]; a[0] = 10; a[1] = 20; a[2] = 30; int baseOffset = Unsafe.arrayBaseOffset(a.getClass()); int indexScale = Unsafe.arrayIndexScale(a.getClass()); } }

elements.contents: Arr.java:11: non-static method arrayBaseOffset(java.lang.Class) cannot be referenced from a static context int baseOffset = Unsafe.arrayBaseOffset(a.getClass()); ^ Arr.java:12: non-static method arrayIndexScale(java.lang.Class) cannot be referenced from a static context int indexScale = Unsafe.arrayIndexScale(a.getClass()); ^

fragments.text: ) cannot be referenced from a static context int
) cannot be referenced from a static context int

units.rawText: Arr.java:11: non-static method arrayBaseOffset(java.lang.Class) cannot be referenced from a static context int baseOffset = Unsafe.arrayBaseOffset(a.getClass()); ^ Arr.java:12: non-static method arrayIndexScale(java.lang.Class) cannot be referenced from a static context int indexScale = Unsafe.arrayIndexScale(a.getClass()); ^

node.contents: The arrayBaseOffset and arrayIndexScale methods are not static, so you cannot call them the way you are. You need to do it like this:

astNode.text: The arrayBaseOffset and arrayIndexScale methods are not static, so you cannot call them the way you are. You need to do it like this:

elements.contents: Unsafe u = Unsafe.getUnsafe(); int baseOffset = u.arrayBaseOffset(a.getClass()); int indexScale = u.arrayIndexScale(a.getClass());

units.rawText: Unsafe u = Unsafe.getUnsafe(); int baseOffset = u.arrayBaseOffset(a.getClass()); int indexScale = u.arrayIndexScale(a.getClass());
